Dear Pauline

 

Further to my email dated 21 August, I have continued to chase AXA for corrected documentation. I have advised them the situation is unacceptable and asked that the matter be escalated.

 

However, in the meantime, I would ask that you arrange settlement of the outstanding renewal  to avoid the possibility of cover being cancelled. 

 

I am also conscious that the policy is due for renewal on 1st January and we may have issues obtaining renewal terms if the premiums are still outstanding.

 

Many thanks

 

Kind regards

 

Teresa Woodward, Cert CII

Account Handler, Global & Corporate Risks

Dear Pauline

 

We have received policy documentation from AXA for your Material Damage & Business Interruption policy.

 

The sums insured are still incorrect, but AXA have advised they have notified their lead Producing Office who will issue an endorsement reflecting the changes and advise of any additional premium that may apply . Hopefully, this will follow shortly.

 

In the meantime please find attached the issued policy document. I would draw your attention to the following –

 

-          Deductibles – page 8

-          General Exclusions – page 17

-          General Conditions – page 57

-          General Clauses – page 61

-          Claims Conditions – page 65

 

You should read any claims conditions carefully as failure to comply with the conditions could result in a claim being reduced or rejected

Dear Pauline

 

We have received policy documentation from AXA for your Material Damage & Business Interruption policy.

 

The sums insured are still incorrect, but AXA have advised they have notified their lead Producing Office who will issue an endorsement reflecting the changes and advise of any additional premium that may apply . Hopefully, this will follow shortly.

 

In the meantime please find attached the issued policy document. I would draw your attention to the following –

 

*	Deductibles – page 8
*	General Exclusions – page 17
*	General Conditions – page 57
*	General Clauses – page 61
*	Claims Conditions – page 65

 

You should read any claims conditions carefully as failure to comply with the conditions could result in a claim being reduced or rejected

 

Also attached is our invoice for the renewal premium.

 

Duty of Fair Presentation

 

We take this opportunity to remind you that you owe a duty to make a fair presentation of the risk to the insurer. 

you have a duty to disclose to the insurer every material circumstance which you know or ought to know after a reasonable search or which is sufficient to put the insurer on notice that it needs to make further enquiries for the purpose of revealing those material circumstances. In addition, you have a duty to disclose information in a clear and accessible manner

 

Whilst the documentation has been checked we would recommend that you also check this carefully to ensure it meets your requirements. Should they have any queries please let me know.

 

If you would like to receive a paper copy of the enclosed documents please let us know and we will send these to you.

*	Deductibles – page 8
*	General Exclusions – page 17
*	General Conditions – page 57
*	General Clauses – page 61
*	Claims Conditions – page 65

 

You should read any claims conditions carefully as failure to comply with the conditions could result in a claim being reduced or rejected

Whilst the documentation has been checked we would recommend that you also check this carefully to ensure it meets your requirements. Should they have any queries please let me know.

 

If you would like to receive a paper copy of the enclosed documents please let us know and we will send these to you.
